title: Task 54

question.text: What aspect of Bob's statement to Lisa is considered surprising?

answers.answer: That Lisa can talk to Sarah at any time.
answers.feedback: While this is part of the statement, it's not the surprising element.

answers.answer: That Lisa can talk to Sarah at any time even in a virtual setting.

answers.feedback: Having questions is quite normal and not the surprising part of the statement.

answers.answer: That Lisa is talking to Sarah, not Bob.
answers.feedback: The statement is about whom Lisa can talk to, not about who is currently talking.

dialogue.text: You can talk to her anytime, even in this virtual setting, if you have questions, Lisa.

description: In Bob's statement, he uses the word even to introduce a surprising or notable aspect. Even is often used to emphasize something that may not be expected or is additional to what has already been mentioned.
